name: collections::binary_heap::BinaryHeap::<T, A>::retain

collections::binary_heap::RebuildOnDrop: Unknown([Field(0, Ty { id: 1988, kind: RigidTy(Ref(Region { kind: ReErased }, Ty { id: 1982, kind: RigidTy(Adt(AdtDef(DefId { id: 3295, name: "collections::binary_heap::BinaryHeap" }), GenericArgs([Type(Ty { id: 10, kind: Param(ParamTy { index: 0, name: "T" }) }), Type(Ty { id: 21, kind: Param(ParamTy { index: 1, name: "A" }) })]))) }, Mut)) })])

doc:
Retains only the elements specified by the predicate.

 In other words, remove all elements `e` for which `f(&e)` returns
 `false`. The elements are visited in unsorted (and unspecified) order.

 # Examples

 Basic usage:

 ```
 use std::collections::BinaryHeap;

 let mut heap = BinaryHeap::from([-10, -5, 1, 2, 4, 13]);

 heap.retain(|x| x % 2 == 0); // only keep even numbers

 assert_eq!(heap.into_sorted_vec(), [-10, 2, 4])
 ```
